metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0920 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In unix_scm_to_skb of af_unix.c, there is a possible use after free bug due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-196926917References: Upstream kernel It was discovered a race condition existed in the Unix domain socket implementation in the Linux kernel, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-aws - 4.4.0-1103.108
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.108').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1').
